Identification_Area.title: NICOLET NEXUS 670 FTIR SPECTROMETER for LAB9884

Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

Instrument_PDS3.instrument_desc: Instrument Overview =================== An aluminum alloy sample chamber fitted with sapphire windows is mounted atop a two stage closed cycle helium refrigerator. For thermal insulation, this assembly is enclosed within a vacuum chamber with another pair of sapphire windows. The beam from the Fourier transform infrared spectrometer passes through the sapphire windows, through the sample, and is focused onto a HgCdTe detector. Gas mixtures are prepared in a 2 liter mixing volume at room temperature and then allowed to condense in the sample volume through a fill tube entering from above. Sample temperature is monitored via a pair of silicon diodes mounted just above and just below the sample volume, and temperature control is maintained via a pair of heating elements, one above and one below the sample volume.
